title: Things You Thought You’d Never Do
instructions: You are going to read some information about different women. For Questions 21–35, choose from the women (A–F). Some may be chosen more than once.

texts.content: A — 'I took a dive' ... I was terrified of heights. My friends were leaping off the high diving board. Seeing them enjoying themselves encouraged me. I didn’t enjoy it at first but later felt confident.

evidence.text: I did feel a great sense of achievement

texts.content: B — 'I went travelling' ... I had to give up my job, but I was unhappy in it. My friends encouraged me, but I couldn’t decide whether to go. I was afraid of losing friends but the trip was wonderful.

evidence.text: I had to give up my job ... I was not happy

texts.content: C — 'I ran a marathon' ... I watched my husband and Richard run. It encouraged me to take part. Running it was awful. I learnt so much about people.

evidence.text: I learnt so much about people

texts.content: D — 'I wrote a novel' ... At school I was discouraged from writing. People criticised me online but I didn’t mind. I said out loud I wasn't prepared to do that. Now I am more confident.

evidence.text: I said I wasn't prepared to do that
people criticised me ... I didn't mind

texts.content: E — 'I left my job' ... I earn less money now than before. I had a dull job I did not enjoy. I got ill unexpectedly which made me rethink everything. Now I feel more confident than ever.

evidence.text: I had a dull job ... I did not enjoy

texts.content: F — 'I took a difficult exam' ... At home with small children, I decided to sign up after a young girl encouraged me unexpectedly. She made me take charge.

evidence.text: a girl made me decide to take charge
